channel.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
channel.description: By using RSMV, am I breaking any RS rules? How about using the cache unpacker? Is that against the rules?

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Wolf Dog 99, post:15, topic:285148”]Hey Mopar i reccomend deleting this topic since you are currently fighting with jagex and their adlex solicitors jagex could easily draw this from the fourms

just look at Miss Silabsoft’s comments and you will see that jagex could use this against you[/quote]

As I stated in my comments, it ISN’T illegal, and nothing about this site is illegal either. So I’m not deleting it.

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:285148”][quote author=azliq7 link=topic=376856.msg2838707#msg2838707 date=1245825900]
By using RSMV, am I breaking any RS rules? How about using the cache unpacker? Is that against the rules?
[/quote]

I’m sure you are breaking Jagex’s rules, but that is far different than breaking the law, and they can’t do anything to you for it.

An example would be me making a rule you have to agree to to be on this site, let’s say I say you can’t eat carrots every second tuesday of the month. You go and eat carrots on the second tuesday of the month. You just broke my TOS, so I can send you all the nasty letters that I want, and have my lawyer send you all the nasty letters that I want to pay for, but it’s never going to court because in no way is it legally binding. Same thing goes for jagex’s TOS.[/quote]
They make their own rules to scare young, moronic people off; which makes sense because those are the very same people who play their asinine game.

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“azliq7, post:11, topic:285148”][quote author=qauters link=topic=376856.msg2839038#msg2839038 date=1245855257]
Although you are allowed to reverse engineer anything located on your pc, you are not allowed to release that to others.
So plainly, a private server is legal as long as you don’t send the cache or anything else that is property of Jagex Ltd.
[/quote]

I’ve seen someone posted images of unreleased items such as Music cape on YouTube, and I was wondering if it can be posted in a fan website.[/quote]
You are not allowed, unless Jagex gives you permission

Read full topic

either way, as long as you use it privately you wont get in trouble for it

[quote=“qauters, post:9, topic:285148”]Although you are allowed to reverse engineer anything located on your pc, you are not allowed to release that to others.
So plainly, a private server is legal as long as you don’t send the cache or anything else that is property of Jagex Ltd.[/quote]

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

qauters:

So plainly, a private server is legal as long as you don’t send the cache or anything else that is property of Jagex Ltd.

Maybe in your country, but not in others. Server Emulator developers have lost in court before. (Over reverse engineering, not copyright law)

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Mopman:

What I want to know is why that dosen’t make private servers quite plainly legal, but apparently it dosen’t… can’t we get a MITB lawyer?

Although you are allowed to reverse engineer anything located on your pc, you are not allowed to release that to others.
So plainly, a private server is legal as long as you don’t send the cache or anything else that is property of Jagex Ltd.

Same goes for bots, SCAR is legal while RSBot isn’t.

Those laws are misinterpreted a lot really, same goes for hacking your mobile to remove simlock.
It’s forbidden by your phone company but legal according to the law.

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

azliq7:

By using RSMV, am I breaking any RS rules? How about using the cache unpacker? Is that against the rules?

I’m sure you are breaking Jagex’s rules, but that is far different than breaking the law, and they can’t do anything to you for it.

An example would be me making a rule you have to agree to to be on this site, let’s say I say you can’t eat carrots every second tuesday of the month. You go and eat carrots on the second tuesday of the month. You just broke my TOS, so I can send you all the nasty letters that I want, and have my lawyer send you all the nasty letters that I want to pay for, but it’s never going to court because in no way is it legally binding. Same thing goes for jagex’s TOS.

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Not sure how legally binding that is, tbh, you can’t just randomly make contracts that go against law, and reverse engineering is perfectly legal unless it contravenes the DMCA

DMCA:

(2) Notwithstanding the provisions of subsections (a)(2) and (b), a person may develop and employ technological means to circumvent a technological measure, or to circumvent protection afforded by a technological measure, in order to enable the identification and analysis under paragraph (1), or for the purpose of enabling interoperability of an independently created computer program with other programs, if such means are necessary to achieve such interoperability, to the extent that doing so does not constitute infringement under this title.

What I want to know is why that dosen’t make private servers quite plainly legal, but apparently it dosen’t… can’t we get a MITB lawyer?

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Model Viewer illegal?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Intellectual property rights Jagex®, RuneScape® and FunOrb® are registered trade marks of Jagex Limited in the United Kingdom, the United States and other countries.

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators).

Materials (including without limit all information, software, data, text, photographs, graphics, sound and video) placed on any Jagex Product by us or on our behalf are protected by copyright and other intellectual property rights of ourselves or our business partners / suppliers / advertisers. You may not use these materials or any Jagex Product except in accordance with these terms and conditions and for personal (i.e. non-commercial) use only.

You agree that all intellectual property or other rights in any game character, account and items are and will remain our property.

By posting chat or other materials on any Jagex Product, you grant us a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty free, worldwide license to use and/or modify such materials on any Jagex Product as we see fit.

You agree that by submitting any material of any kind to us for any purpose connected with any Jagex Product (non-exhaustive examples are suggestions and ideas for any game or contributions to any Gallery page), you are giving us a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free license to use and/or modify the submitted materials as we see fit. You agree to waive any moral rights to the extent permitted by law and that you will not withdraw the submission or attempt to make a charge for its use. Furthermore you guarantee that you are the exclusive copyright holder in relation to the submission and that the submission in no way breaches the rights of any other person or entity.

Read full topic
